I know Americans aren't the smartest people in the world but why do they even leave packages at the door? That's just asking for problems.. Here in The Netherlands packages only get delivered when the people who ordered it are actually at home. If they aren't at home the delivery driver has the choice to leave it at a neighbour (which gets digitally registered) or he has to take it back to try again the next day. Delivery drivers aren't even allowed to leave packages at the door, they'll actually get fired for that.  Such a simple solution to such a big problem..

The fact is that your videos are comedic and entertaining, which is absolutely fine and most likely fairly harmless, but they're not a solution to anything. Saying that they are kind of pedals the narrative that crime is an individualistic problem, and not a societal one. San Francisco is the car break-in capital not because there are the most bad eggs per capita of any city, but because of gentrification, inflation in housing prices, and lack of access to economic advancement. Here in western Europe, when a package can't be handed over to you, they try your neighbors, and put a note in your mailbox.
